Barack Obama.passage: Barack Hussein Obama II is an American politician and attorney who served as the 44th president of the United States from 2009 to 2017. A member of the Democratic Party, he was the first African American to serve as president. Born in Honolulu, Hawaii, Obama is a graduate of Columbia University and Harvard Law School. He began his political career as a community organizer before becoming a civil rights attorney. He then served in the Illinois State Senate from 1997 to 2004, and in the United States Senate from 2005 to 2008. Obama's presidential campaign in 2008 focused on issues such as healthcare reform, climate change, and ending the Iraq War. He defeated Republican nominee John McCain in the general election, winning 365 electoral votes to McCain's 173. Obama was re-elected in 2012, defeating Republican nominee Mitt Romney. As president, Obama signed into law the Affordable Care Act, also known as Obamacare, which expanded access to healthcare for millions of Americans. He also signed the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act, which aimed to prevent another financial crisis like the one that occurred in 2008. Obama's foreign policy focused on ending the wars in Iraq and Afghanistan, and he oversaw the killing of al-Qaeda leader Osama bin Laden in 2011. He also worked to improve relations with Cuba and Iran, and negotiated the Paris Agreement on climate change. After leaving office, Obama has continued to be involved in politics and social issues. He founded the Obama Foundation, which aims to inspire and empower the next generation of leaders. He has also been a vocal advocate for gun control, immigration reform, and racial justice. Obama's presidency was marked by both accomplishments and challenges, and his legacy continues to be debated. However, he remains a highly respected figure in American politics and around the world.

Hillary Clinton.passage: Hillary Diane Rodham Clinton is an American politician, diplomat, lawyer, writer, and public speaker who served as the 67th United States Secretary of State from 2009 to 2013, as a United States Senator from New York from 2001 to 2009, and as First Lady of the United States from 1993 to 2001. Clinton became the first woman to be nominated for president of the United States by a major political party when she won the Democratic Party nomination in 2016. She was the first woman to win the popular vote in an American presidential election, which she lost to Donald Trump. Born in Chicago, Illinois, and raised in the Chicago suburb of Park Ridge, Clinton graduated from Wellesley College in 1969 and earned a Juris Doctor from Yale Law School in 1973. After serving as a congressional legal counsel, she moved to Arkansas and married future president Bill Clinton in 1975. In 1977, she co-founded Arkansas Advocates for Children and Families. She was appointed the first female chair of the Legal Services Corporation in 1978, and became the first female partner at Rose Law Firm the following year. As First Lady of Arkansas, she led a task force whose recommendations helped reform Arkansas's public schools. As First Lady of the United States, Clinton was an advocate for gender equality and healthcare reform. Her marital relationship came under public scrutiny during the Lewinsky scandal, which led her to issue a statement that reaffirmed her commitment to the marriage. In 2000, Clinton was elected as the first female senator from New York. She was re-elected to the Senate in 2006. Running for president in 2008, she won far more delegates than any previous female candidate, but lost the Democratic nomination to Barack Obama. During her tenure as Secretary of State, Clinton advocated the U.S. pivot to Asia, helped negotiate a ceasefire in the Gaza War, and negotiated the Iran nuclear deal. She also led the response to the Arab Spring and advocated for the overthrow of Muammar Gaddafi in Libya. Clinton unsuccessfully sought the Democratic presidential nomination in 2016, but won the popular vote by nearly three million votes. After leaving office, she wrote her memoir, What Happened, and launched Onward Together, a political action organization dedicated to fundraising for progressive political groups.

Donald Trump.passage: Donald John Trump (born June 14, 1946) is an American businessman, television personality, author, and politician who served as the 45th president of the United States from 2017 to 2021. Prior to his presidency, he was known for his real estate empire and his role as the host of the reality television show The Apprentice. Trump was born and raised in Queens, New York City, and earned an economics degree from the Wharton School of the University of Pennsylvania. He took over his father's real estate business in 1971 and expanded it into a global empire, with properties in New York City, Atlantic City, Florida, and other locations around the world. He also became a prominent figure in the entertainment industry, owning the Miss Universe and Miss USA beauty pageants. In 2015, Trump announced his candidacy for president of the United States, running as a Republican. He campaigned on a platform of economic nationalism, promising to bring back jobs to the United States and to renegotiate trade deals that he believed were unfair to American workers. He also promised to build a wall along the U.S.-Mexico border to curb illegal immigration. Despite facing controversy throughout his campaign, including accusations of racism and sexism, Trump won the 2016 presidential election, defeating Democratic nominee Hillary Clinton. During his presidency, he implemented a number of controversial policies, including a travel ban on citizens of several Muslim-majority countries, a repeal of the Affordable Care Act, and a tax overhaul that primarily benefited corporations and the wealthy. Trump's presidency was marked by numerous scandals and controversies, including an ongoing investigation into his campaign's alleged collusion with Russia during the 2016 election, his impeachment by the House of Representatives in 2019 for abuse of power and obstruction of Congress, and his handling of the COVID-19 pandemic, which has resulted in over 500,000 deaths in the United States. Despite his tumultuous presidency, Trump remains a popular figure among many conservative Americans, who view him as a champion of their values and a defender of their interests. He continues to be a prominent voice in the Republican Party and has not ruled out the possibility of running for president again in 2024.

Joe Biden.passage: Joe Biden is an American politician who served as the 47th Vice President of the United States from 2009 to 2017. He was born on November 20, 1942, in Scranton, Pennsylvania, and grew up in a Catholic family. Biden attended the University of Delaware and Syracuse Law School and served on the New Castle County Council. He was first elected to the United States Senate in 1972, at the age of 29, becoming the sixth-youngest senator in American history. During his time in the Senate, Biden served as the chairman of the Foreign Relations Committee and the Judiciary Committee. He was a leading advocate for arms control, environmental protection, and civil rights. Biden was also a strong supporter of the Violence Against Women Act, which he authored and helped pass in 1994. In 2008, Biden was selected by then-Senator Barack Obama as his running mate in the presidential election. The Obama-Biden ticket won the election, and Biden was sworn in as Vice President on January 20, 2009. During his time in office, Biden played a key role in the Obama administration's efforts to pass the Affordable Care Act, also known as Obamacare, and the American Recovery and Reinvestment Act, which aimed to stimulate the economy in the wake of the 2008 financial crisis. Biden was also a strong advocate for LGBT rights and played a key role in the administration's decision to repeal the military's "Don't Ask, Don't Tell" policy. He was also a vocal supporter of the Paris climate agreement and worked to strengthen the United States' relationships with its allies around the world. In 2015, Biden announced that he would not seek the Democratic nomination for president in the 2016 election, citing the recent death of his son Beau. However, he remained active in politics and continued to speak out on issues such as gun control and income inequality. In 2020, Biden announced his candidacy for president, and after a hard-fought primary campaign, he secured the Democratic nomination. In the general election, he faced incumbent President Donald Trump, and after a contentious and closely watched race, Biden was declared the winner on November 7, 2020. Biden's presidency has been marked by a focus on addressing the COVID-19 pandemic, which has claimed the lives of hundreds of thousands of Americans. He has also made efforts to address climate change, racial inequality, and economic recovery.

Nancy Pelosi.passage: Nancy Pelosi is an American politician who has served as the Speaker of the United States House of Representatives since January 2019. She is a member of the Democratic Party and has represented California's 12th congressional district since 1987. Pelosi is the first woman to serve as Speaker of the House and is the highest-ranking female politician in American history. Born in Baltimore, Maryland, Pelosi attended Trinity College in Washington, D.C. before moving to San Francisco, California with her husband, Paul Pelosi. In San Francisco, Pelosi became involved in local politics and was elected as a member of the Democratic National Committee in 1976. She was elected to the House of Representatives in a special election in 1987 and has been re-elected every two years since then. Pelosi has been a vocal advocate for progressive policies throughout her career. She has been a strong supporter of women's rights, LGBTQ rights, and environmental protection. Pelosi was a key figure in the passage of the Affordable Care Act in 2010, which expanded access to healthcare for millions of Americans. She has also been a vocal critic of President Donald Trump and has led efforts to investigate his administration's actions. As Speaker of the House, Pelosi has been responsible for leading the Democratic Party's legislative agenda. She has overseen the passage of several major pieces of legislation, including the American Rescue Plan Act of 2021, which provided economic relief to Americans affected by the COVID-19 pandemic. Pelosi has also been a strong advocate for voting rights and has pushed for the passage of the For the People Act, which would expand access to voting and reduce the influence of money in politics. Pelosi's leadership style has been described as both tough and effective. She is known for her ability to whip votes and get legislation passed, even in the face of opposition from Republicans. Pelosi has also been praised for her ability to work across the aisle and find common ground with Republicans on certain issues. Despite her many accomplishments, Pelosi has also faced criticism from some quarters. Some progressives have accused her of being too moderate and not doing enough to push for more radical policies. Others have criticized her for being too partisan and not doing enough to work with Republicans. Overall, however, Pelosi's legacy is one of accomplishment and leadership. She has been a trailblazer for women in politics and has been a tireless advocate for progressive policies. As Speaker of the House, she has been a powerful force for change and has helped to shape the direction of American politics for decades to come.

Marco Rubio.passage: Marco Rubio is an American politician and attorney who currently serves as the senior United States senator from Florida. Born in Miami, Florida, in 1971, Rubio is the son of Cuban immigrants who fled the communist regime of Fidel Castro. He attended the University of Florida and later earned his law degree from the University of Miami School of Law. Rubio began his political career in 1998 when he was elected to the West Miami City Commission. He later served in the Florida House of Representatives from 2000 to 2008, where he was elected Speaker of the House in 2006. In 2010, Rubio ran for the United States Senate and defeated the incumbent governor, Charlie Crist, in the Republican primary. He went on to win the general election and was sworn in as a senator in January 2011. As a senator, Rubio has been a vocal advocate for conservative policies, including limited government, free enterprise, and a strong national defense. He has also been a leading voice on issues related to immigration reform, education, and foreign policy. In 2013, Rubio was a member of the bipartisan "Gang of Eight" that introduced a comprehensive immigration reform bill in the Senate. The bill ultimately failed to pass, but Rubio has continued to push for immigration reform and has been a vocal critic of President Trump's immigration policies. Rubio has also been a strong supporter of Israel and has been critical of the Obama administration's approach to the Israeli-Palestinian conflict. He has been a frequent critic of the United Nations and has called for the United States to withdraw from the UN Human Rights Council. Rubio has also been a vocal opponent of the Iran nuclear deal and has called for a more aggressive approach to dealing with Iran's nuclear program. In addition to his work in the Senate, Rubio has also been mentioned as a potential presidential candidate. He ran for the Republican nomination in 2016 but ultimately dropped out of the race after losing the Florida primary to Donald Trump. Rubio was re-elected to the Senate in 2016 and is currently serving his second term. Overall, Marco Rubio is a prominent figure in American politics and has been a leading voice on a wide range of issues. He is known for his conservative views and his strong support for Israel and a strong national defense. Despite his unsuccessful bid for the presidency in 2016, Rubio remains a popular figure in the Republican Party and is likely to continue to play a prominent role in American politics for years to come.

Kamala Harris.passage: Kamala Devi Harris is an American politician and attorney who is currently serving as the 49th Vice President of the United States. She was born on October 20, 1964, in Oakland, California, to immigrant parents from India and Jamaica. Harris grew up in a predominantly African American neighborhood and attended Howard University, a historically black college, where she earned a degree in political science and economics. She then went on to earn a law degree from the University of California, Hastings College of the Law. Harris began her career as a deputy district attorney in Alameda County, California, where she specialized in prosecuting child sexual assault cases. She later served as the District Attorney of San Francisco from 2004 to 2011, where she gained a reputation for being tough on crime and advocating for criminal justice reform. In 2011, she was elected as the Attorney General of California, becoming the first woman, the first African American woman, and the first South Asian American woman to hold the position. During her tenure, she focused on issues such as consumer protection, environmental protection, and civil rights. In 2016, Harris was elected to the United States Senate, representing California. She quickly became a prominent voice in the Senate, advocating for progressive policies such as Medicare for All, criminal justice reform, and immigration reform. She also gained national attention for her tough questioning of witnesses during Senate hearings, including Supreme Court nominee Brett Kavanaugh and Attorney General Jeff Sessions. In 2020, Harris was selected as the running mate for Democratic presidential nominee Joe Biden. The Biden-Harris ticket went on to win the 2020 presidential election, defeating incumbent President Donald Trump and Vice President Mike Pence. Harris made history as the first woman, the first African American woman, and the first South Asian American woman to be elected Vice President of the United States. As Vice President, Harris has taken on a number of high-profile issues, including leading the administration's efforts to address the root causes of migration from Central America, advocating for voting rights and election reform, and working to address the COVID-19 pandemic. She has also been a vocal advocate for racial justice and police reform, and has worked to promote economic opportunity and equity for all Americans. Throughout her career, Harris has been a trailblazer and a champion for justice and equality. She has broken barriers and shattered glass ceilings, paving the way for future generations of women and people of color to follow in her footsteps.

Elizabeth Warren.passage: Elizabeth Warren is an American politician, academic, and lawyer who currently serves as the senior United States senator from Massachusetts. Born in Oklahoma City, Oklahoma, in 1949, Warren attended George Washington University and earned a law degree from Rutgers Law School. She began her career as a law professor at several universities, including the University of Houston, the University of Texas at Austin, and Harvard Law School. In the early 2000s, Warren became a prominent advocate for consumer protection and financial regulation. She served as the chair of the Congressional Oversight Panel, which oversaw the implementation of the Troubled Asset Relief Program (TARP) in response to the 2008 financial crisis. She also helped establish the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB), a federal agency that regulates financial institutions and protects consumers from predatory lending practices. In 2012, Warren ran for the U.S. Senate in Massachusetts and defeated incumbent Republican Scott Brown. She has since been reelected twice, in 2018 and 2020. As a senator, Warren has focused on issues such as income inequality, student loan debt, and healthcare. She has proposed a wealth tax on the wealthiest Americans, which she argues would raise revenue to fund social programs and reduce economic inequality. Warren has also been a vocal critic of President Donald Trump and his administration. She was one of the first Democrats to call for Trump's impeachment, and she has been a frequent target of his attacks on social media. In the 2020 Democratic presidential primary, Warren was one of the frontrunners for the nomination, but ultimately dropped out of the race after disappointing results in early primary contests. Throughout her career, Warren has been recognized for her advocacy on behalf of consumers and working families. She has received numerous awards and honors, including the Hubert H. Humphrey Civil Rights Award, the National Women's History Museum's Women Making History Award, and the AFL-CIO's Government Service Award.

Bernie Sanders.passage: Bernard Sanders, commonly known as Bernie Sanders, is an American politician who has served as the junior United States Senator from Vermont since 2007. He is a member of the Democratic Party and identifies as a democratic socialist. Sanders ran for the Democratic nomination for President of the United States in both 2016 and 2020, gaining a significant following and popularizing progressive policies such as Medicare for All, free college tuition, and a $15 minimum wage. Sanders was born in Brooklyn, New York in 1941 and attended the University of Chicago, where he became involved in the civil rights movement. He moved to Vermont in 1968 and became active in local politics, eventually serving as mayor of Burlington from 1981 to 1989. In 1990, he was elected to the United States House of Representatives, where he served for 16 years before being elected to the Senate. Throughout his political career, Sanders has been a vocal advocate for progressive policies and social justice. He has consistently opposed cuts to social welfare programs and has been a strong supporter of workers' rights, environmental protection, and campaign finance reform. He has also been a vocal critic of the influence of big money in politics and has refused to accept corporate donations in his campaigns. Sanders' 2016 presidential campaign was notable for its grassroots support and its focus on economic inequality. He won 23 primaries and caucuses and garnered over 13 million votes, but ultimately lost the nomination to Hillary Clinton. Mike Pence.passage: Mike Pence is an American politician and lawyer who served as the 48th Vice President of the United States from 2017 to 2021. Born on June 7, 1959, in Columbus, Indiana, Pence grew up in a Catholic family and attended Hanover College, where he earned a bachelor's degree in history. He later attended Indiana University's Robert H. McKinney School of Law, where he earned his law degree. Pence began his political career in 2000 when he was elected to the United States House of Representatives, representing Indiana's 2nd congressional district. He served in the House for six terms, from 2001 to 2013, and was known for his conservative views on social issues such as abortion and same-sex marriage. In 2013, he was elected Governor of Indiana, serving in that role until 2017. As Vice President, Pence was known for his loyalty to President Donald Trump and his conservative views on issues such as immigration, healthcare, and foreign policy. He was also a key figure in the Trump administration's response to the COVID-19 pandemic, leading the White House Coronavirus Task Force. During his time as Vice President, Pence was involved in several controversial moments, including his decision to walk out of an NFL game in protest of players kneeling during the national anthem and his role in the Trump administration's policy of separating families at the US-Mexico border. Pence is a devout Christian and has been vocal about his faith throughout his political career. He has been married to his wife, Karen Pence, since 1985, and they have three children together. After leaving office in January 2021, Pence has remained active in conservative politics and has been rumored to be considering a run for president in 2024.

Mitch McConnell.passage:
Mitch McConnell is an American politician who has served as the senior United States Senator from Kentucky since 1985. He is a member of the Republican Party and has been the Senate Majority Leader since 2015. McConnell is known for his conservative views and his ability to navigate the complex political landscape of Washington, D.C.

Born in Sheffield, Alabama in 1942, McConnell grew up in Louisville, Kentucky. He attended the University of Louisville and graduated with a degree in political science in 1964. After college, McConnell worked as an intern for Senator John Sherman Cooper of Kentucky and later served as a staff assistant for Senator Marlow Cook. In 1977, McConnell was elected to the Jefferson County Judge/Executive, a position he held for eight years. He was then elected to the U.S. Senate in 1984, defeating incumbent Democrat Walter Dee Huddleston. McConnell has since been re-elected five times, most recently in 2020. As a senator, McConnell has been a staunch conservative and has been a vocal opponent of many Democratic policies. He has been a strong advocate for limited government, lower taxes, and a strong national defense. McConnell has also been a vocal opponent of abortion and has supported efforts to restrict access to the procedure. In addition to his work in the Senate, McConnell has also been involved in Republican Party politics. He served as the chairman of the National Republican Senatorial Committee from 1998 to 2000 and as the chairman of the Republican National Committee from 2001 to 2003. McConnell's tenure as Senate Majority Leader has been marked by his ability to navigate the complex political landscape of Washington, D.C. He has been able to pass several major pieces of legislation, including the Tax Cuts and Jobs Act of 2017 and the First Step Act of 2018. McConnell has also been a key player in the confirmation of several conservative judges to the federal bench, including Supreme Court Justices Neil Gorsuch, Brett Kavanaugh, and Amy Coney Barrett. Despite his successes, McConnell has also faced criticism from both Democrats and Republicans. Some have accused him of being too partisan and obstructing Democratic policies, while others have criticized him for not doing enough to support President Donald Trump. Overall, McConnell is a powerful and influential figure in American politics. His conservative views and political savvy have made him a force to be reckoned with in Washington, D.C. and he is likely to continue to play a major role in shaping the future of the Republican Party and the country as a whole.

Rand Paul.passage: Rand Paul is an American politician and physician who currently serves as the junior United States Senator from Kentucky. He was born on January 7, 1963, in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, to former Congressman Ron Paul and his wife Carol. Rand Paul grew up in Texas and attended Baylor University, where he earned a degree in biology. He then went on to attend Duke University School of Medicine, where he earned his medical degree. After completing his medical training, Rand Paul moved to Bowling Green, Kentucky, where he established his own ophthalmology practice. He became involved in politics in 2009, when he founded the Kentucky Taxpayers United, a group that advocates for limited government and fiscal responsibility. In 2010, he ran for the United States Senate as a Republican and won, defeating the Democratic candidate Jack Conway. As a senator, Rand Paul has been a vocal advocate for limited government, individual liberty, and fiscal responsibility. He has been a leading critic of the National Security Agency's surveillance programs and has introduced legislation to reform the agency's practices. He has also been a vocal opponent of the Affordable Care Act, commonly known as Obamacare, and has introduced legislation to repeal the law. Rand Paul has been a frequent critic of the Republican Party establishment and has been known for his willingness to challenge his own party's leadership. He has been a vocal opponent of the party's interventionist foreign policy and has called for a more restrained approach to foreign affairs. He has also been a vocal advocate for criminal justice reform and has introduced legislation to reduce mandatory minimum sentences for nonviolent drug offenses. In addition to his work in the Senate, Rand Paul has also been involved in a number of other political and philanthropic activities. He has been a frequent speaker at conservative conferences and has written several books on politics and economics. He has also been involved in a number of charitable organizations, including the Lions Club and the March of Dimes. Rand Paul is married to Kelley Ashby Paul, and they have three children. He is a devout Christian and has been active in his local church. He is also an avid outdoorsman and enjoys hunting and fishing in his free time.

Andrew Cuomo.passage: Andrew Cuomo is an American politician who served as the 56th Governor of New York from 2011 to 2021. Born on December 6, 1957, in Queens, New York, Cuomo is the son of former New York Governor Mario Cuomo and the brother of CNN journalist Chris Cuomo. He graduated from Fordham University in 1979 and received his law degree from Albany Law School in 1982. Cuomo began his political career as an assistant district attorney in New York City before serving as the Secretary of Housing and Urban Development under President Bill Clinton from 1997 to 2001. In 2006, he was elected as the Attorney General of New York, a position he held until his election as governor in 2010. As governor, Cuomo focused on a number of key issues, including economic development, education reform, and healthcare. He implemented a number of policies aimed at improving the state's economy, including tax cuts for businesses and a $1 billion investment in the Buffalo Billion program to revitalize the upstate economy. He also championed the passage of the Marriage Equality Act in 2011, which legalized same-sex marriage in New York. Cuomo's tenure as governor was not without controversy, however. In 2014, he faced criticism for his handling of the Ebola outbreak in New York City, and in 2018, he faced allegations of sexual harassment from several women, including former aides. In 2020, Cuomo faced further criticism for his handling of the COVID-19 pandemic in New York, particularly with regard to nursing home deaths. Despite these controversies, Cuomo remained a popular figure in New York politics for much of his tenure as governor. He was reelected in 2014 and 2018, and was widely considered a potential candidate for the Democratic nomination for president in 2020. However, his political fortunes took a dramatic turn in 2021, when he faced a series of scandals and controversies that ultimately led to his resignation as governor in August of that year. Cuomo's legacy as governor of New York remains a subject of debate and controversy. While he is credited with a number of significant accomplishments during his tenure, including the legalization of same-sex marriage and the revitalization of the upstate economy, his handling of the COVID-19 pandemic and the allegations of sexual harassment have tarnished his reputation in the eyes of many.

Gavin Newsom.passage: Gavin Christopher Newsom is an American politician and businessman who currently serves as the 40th governor of California. Born on October 10, 1967, in San Francisco, California, Newsom grew up in a politically active family. His father, William Newsom, was a state appeals court judge, and his mother, Tessa Newsom, was involved in various community organizations. Newsom attended Redwood High School in Marin County and went on to study political science at Santa Clara University. After college, he worked in the hospitality industry, managing a wine store and a series of restaurants in San Francisco. In 1996, he opened his own business, the PlumpJack Group, which included a wine shop, a hotel, and several restaurants. Newsom's political career began in 1997 when he was appointed to the San Francisco Board of Supervisors. He quickly gained a reputation as a progressive voice on the board, advocating for issues such as same-sex marriage and universal healthcare. In 2003, he was elected mayor of San Francisco, becoming the city's youngest mayor in over a century. As mayor, Newsom implemented a number of progressive policies, including universal healthcare for city residents and a program to provide homeless people with housing and services. He also gained national attention for his decision to allow same-sex marriages to take place in San Francisco, which led to a legal battle that ultimately resulted in the state's legalization of same-sex marriage. In 2010, Newsom was elected lieutenant governor of California, serving under Governor Jerry Brown. During his time as lieutenant governor, he focused on issues such as renewable energy and early childhood education. In 2018, Newsom ran for governor of California and won in a landslide victory. As governor, he has continued to champion progressive policies, including expanding healthcare coverage, increasing funding for education, and addressing the state's housing crisis. He has also been a vocal critic of the Trump administration's immigration policies and has taken steps to protect undocumented immigrants in California. Overall, Gavin Newsom is known for his progressive politics and his commitment to social justice issues. He has been a leading voice in the fight for LGBTQ rights and has worked to make California a more equitable and inclusive state.

Justin Trudeau.passage: Justin Trudeau is a Canadian politician who has been serving as the 23rd Prime Minister of Canada since 2015. He was born on December 25, 1971, in Ottawa, Ontario, Canada, to former Prime Minister Pierre Trudeau and his wife Margaret Sinclair. Trudeau is the second-youngest Canadian Prime Minister in history, after Joe Clark. Trudeau attended Collège Jean-de-Brébeuf, a private French-language high school in Montreal, and then went on to study literature at McGill University. He later earned a degree in education from the University of British Columbia and a degree in engineering from École Polytechnique de Montréal. Trudeau entered politics in 2008, when he won the Liberal Party nomination for the riding of Papineau in Montreal. He was elected to the House of Commons in the 2008 federal election and was re-elected in 2011 and 2015. In 2013, he was elected leader of the Liberal Party of Canada, defeating several other candidates in a leadership race. As Prime Minister, Trudeau has focused on issues such as climate change, gender equality, and reconciliation with Indigenous peoples. He has also been a vocal advocate for free trade and has worked to strengthen Canada's relationships with other countries, particularly the United States and China. Trudeau has faced criticism for his handling of several issues, including the SNC-Lavalin scandal, which involved allegations of political interference in a criminal case against a Canadian engineering firm. He has also been criticized for his government's handling of the COVID-19 pandemic, particularly in regards to vaccine procurement and distribution. Despite these challenges, Trudeau remains a popular figure in Canadian politics, with a strong base of support among young voters and progressive Canadians. He has been praised for his charisma, his commitment to diversity and inclusion, and his willingness to take bold action on important issues. Overall, Justin Trudeau is a dynamic and influential figure in Canadian politics, with a strong record of leadership and a commitment to making Canada a more just and equitable society.

Angela Merkel.passage: Angela Merkel is a German politician who has been the Chancellor of Germany since 2005. She is the first woman to hold this position and is widely regarded as one of the most powerful women in the world. Merkel was born in Hamburg, West Germany, in 1954 and grew up in East Germany. She studied physics at the University of Leipzig and earned a doctorate in quantum chemistry in 1986. Merkel began her political career in 1989, after the fall of the Berlin Wall. She joined the Christian Democratic Union (CDU) and was appointed Minister for Women and Youth in 1991. In 1998, she became the Secretary-General of the CDU and was elected to the Bundestag, the German parliament. In 2000, she was appointed Minister for the Environment, Nature Conservation and Nuclear Safety. In 2005, Merkel was elected Chancellor of Germany, succeeding Gerhard Schröder. She has since been re-elected three times, in 2009, 2013, and 2017. Merkel is known for her pragmatic and cautious approach to politics, and for her commitment to European integration. She has played a key role in managing the Eurozone crisis and in negotiating the Minsk II agreement, which aimed to end the conflict in Ukraine. Merkel has been praised for her leadership during the COVID-19 pandemic, and for her response to the refugee crisis in 2015. However, she has also faced criticism for her handling of the Greek debt crisis and for her support of the Nord Stream 2 gas pipeline. Merkel has been awarded numerous honors and awards, including the Presidential Medal of Freedom from President Barack Obama in 2011. She has also been named Time magazine's Person of the Year twice, in 2015 and 2019. Merkel has announced that she will not seek re-election in the 2021 federal election, and will step down as Chancellor at the end of her term.

Emmanuel Macron.passage: Emmanuel Macron is a French politician who has been serving as the President of France since May 2017. Born on December 21, 1977, in Amiens, Macron was educated at the Lycée Henri-IV in Paris and later attended the École nationale d'administration (ENA) where he graduated in 2004. After completing his education, Macron worked as an Inspector of Finances in the French Ministry of Economy. In 2012, Macron joined the administration of President François Hollande as Deputy Secretary-General of the Élysée Palace. He later served as Minister of the Economy, Industry, and Digital Affairs from 2014 to 2016. During his tenure as Minister, Macron implemented a series of economic reforms aimed at boosting growth and reducing unemployment in France. In 2016, Macron resigned from his position as Minister and founded his own political party, En Marche! (On the Move!). The party was founded on a centrist platform and aimed to bridge the gap between the left and right in French politics. Macron's decision to run for President in 2017 was met with skepticism from many in the French political establishment, but he was able to win the election in a landslide victory. As President, Macron has continued to pursue his centrist agenda, implementing a series of reforms aimed at modernizing the French economy and reducing bureaucracy. He has also been a vocal advocate for European integration and has called for greater cooperation between European nations on issues such as immigration and defense. Macron's presidency has not been without controversy, however. His proposed reforms to the French labor code have been met with protests from labor unions, and his handling of the Yellow Vest protests in 2018 and 2019 was criticized by some as heavy-handed. Despite these challenges, Macron remains a popular figure in French politics and has been praised for his efforts to modernize the French economy and promote European integration.

Vladimir Putin.passage: Vladimir Vladimirovich Putin is a Russian politician and former intelligence officer who has been serving as the President of the Russian Federation since 2012. He previously served as President from 2000 to 2008 and as Prime Minister from 1999 to 2000 and again from 2008 to 2012. Putin is widely considered to be one of the most powerful and influential politicians in the world, and his leadership has been marked by a strong emphasis on national security, economic development, and the restoration of Russia's status as a major world power. Born in Leningrad (now Saint Petersburg) in 1952, Putin graduated from Leningrad State University in 1975 with a law degree. He joined the KGB, the Soviet Union's security agency, and served as a foreign intelligence officer in East Germany from 1985 to 1990. After the collapse of the Soviet Union, Putin entered politics and served as the head of the Federal Security Service (FSB), the KGB's successor agency, from 1998 to 1999. In 1999, Russian President Boris Yeltsin appointed Putin as Prime Minister, and when Yeltsin resigned on December 31 of that year, Putin became acting President. He was elected President in 2000, and during his first two terms in office, he oversaw significant economic growth and stability in Russia. However, his tenure was also marked by a crackdown on political opposition and the media, as well as allegations of human rights abuses and corruption. After serving as Prime Minister under President Dmitry Medvedev from 2008 to 2012, Putin was elected President again in 2012 and re-elected in 2018. His third term has been marked by a more assertive foreign policy, including Russia's annexation of Crimea in 2014 and its involvement in the Syrian Civil War. Putin has also faced criticism for his government's handling of the COVID-19 pandemic and its impact on the Russian economy. Despite these challenges, Putin remains a popular figure in Russia, with approval ratings consistently above 80%. He has been praised for his leadership in restoring Russia's status as a major world power and for his efforts to modernize the country's economy and infrastructure. However, he has also been criticized for his authoritarian tendencies and his government's suppression of political opposition and civil liberties.

Xi Jinping.passage: Xi Jinping is a Chinese politician who has been serving as the General Secretary of the Communist Party of China (CPC) since 2012. He is also the President of the People's Republic of China and the Chairman of the Central Military Commission. Xi Jinping is considered one of the most powerful leaders in China's history, and his policies have had a significant impact on the country's political, economic, and social landscape. Born in 1953 in Beijing, Xi Jinping is the son of Xi Zhongxun, a prominent Communist Party leader who was purged during the Cultural Revolution. Xi Jinping was sent to the countryside for "re-education" during this time, but he later returned to Beijing and joined the Communist Party in 1974. He rose through the ranks of the party, serving in various leadership positions in Fujian, Zhejiang, and Shanghai. In 2007, Xi Jinping was appointed to the Politburo Standing Committee, the highest decision-making body in China. He was widely seen as the heir apparent to then-President Hu Jintao, and in 2012, he was elected as the General Secretary of the Communist Party of China. He became the President of the People's Republic of China in 2013, succeeding Hu Jintao. Xi Jinping's leadership has been characterized by a focus on strengthening the Communist Party's control over all aspects of Chinese society. He has launched a massive anti-corruption campaign that has targeted both high-ranking officials and low-level bureaucrats. The campaign has been popular with the Chinese public, but it has also been criticized for being used as a tool to eliminate political rivals. Xi Jinping has also pursued an ambitious foreign policy agenda, seeking to expand China's influence on the global stage. He has launched the Belt and Road Initiative, a massive infrastructure project that aims to connect China with countries across Asia, Europe, and Africa. He has also taken a more assertive stance on territorial disputes in the South China Sea, leading to tensions with neighboring countries and the United States. Despite his popularity among the Chinese public, Xi Jinping's leadership has been criticized for its authoritarian tendencies. He has cracked down on dissent and tightened controls on the media and the internet. Some observers have also expressed concern about his efforts to consolidate power, including the removal of term limits for the presidency in 2018. Overall, Xi Jinping's leadership has had a profound impact on China's political, economic, and social development.

Kim Jong-un.passage: Kim Jong-un is a North Korean politician who has been the Supreme Leader of North Korea since 2011. He is the third and youngest son of Kim Jong-il and his consort Ko Yong-hui. From late 2010, Kim Jong-un was viewed as heir apparent to the leadership of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea (DPRK) and assumed important posts in the party and army organs. He has been the First Secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea since 2012, Chairman of the State Affairs Commission since 2016, and Supreme Commander of the Korean People's Army since 2011. Kim Jong-un was born on 8 January 1982 in Pyongyang, North Korea. Little is known about his early life, but it is believed that he was educated in Switzerland. He returned to North Korea in 2000 and began working in the National Defense Commission, the country's top military body. In 2009, he was appointed to the powerful Central Military Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea. Kim Jong-un became the Supreme Leader of North Korea following the death of his father, Kim Jong-il, in December 2011. He was officially declared the "Great Successor" and "Supreme Commander" of the Korean People's Army. Since taking power, Kim Jong-un has pursued a policy of "byungjin", which aims to develop the country's economy and nuclear weapons program simultaneously. Under Kim Jong-un's leadership, North Korea has conducted several nuclear tests and missile launches, which have led to increased tensions with the international community. In 2018, Kim Jong-un met with South Korean President Moon Jae-in and US President Donald Trump, marking the first time a North Korean leader had met with a sitting US president. The meetings were seen as a potential breakthrough in the long-standing conflict between North Korea and the international community. Kim Jong-un is known for his reclusive nature and has rarely been seen in public. He is married to Ri Sol-ju and has at least one child. He is also known for his love of basketball and has been reported to have a close relationship with former NBA player Dennis Rodman. Kim Jong-un's leadership has been criticized for its human rights abuses, including the use of forced labor camps and the suppression of political dissent. However, he remains a popular figure in North Korea and is seen as a symbol of the country's strength and independence.

Jair Bolsonaro.passage: Jair Bolsonaro is a Brazilian politician and retired military officer who has been serving as the President of Brazil since January 1, 2019. He was born on March 21, 1955, in Campinas, São Paulo, Brazil. Bolsonaro is known for his controversial and right-wing views on various issues, including social, economic, and environmental policies. Bolsonaro began his political career in 1988 when he was elected as a city councilor in Rio de Janeiro. He later served as a federal deputy for the state of Rio de Janeiro from 1991 to 2018. During his time in Congress, Bolsonaro gained a reputation for his outspoken and often controversial statements, particularly on issues related to race, gender, and sexuality. Bolsonaro's political ideology is often described as far-right, and he has been criticized for his support of authoritarianism and his opposition to democracy. He has expressed admiration for past military regimes in Brazil and has been accused of promoting violence and discrimination against marginalized groups. Despite his controversial views, Bolsonaro was elected as President of Brazil in 2018, defeating his left-wing opponent Fernando Haddad in a run-off election. His campaign focused on promises to combat corruption, reduce crime, and revive the Brazilian economy. Since taking office, Bolsonaro has implemented a number of controversial policies, including loosening gun control laws, cutting funding for social programs, and rolling back environmental protections in the Amazon rainforest. He has also faced criticism for his handling of the COVID-19 pandemic in Brazil, which has been one of the worst-hit countries in the world. Bolsonaro's presidency has been marked by ongoing political turmoil and protests, with many Brazilians expressing concern about his authoritarian tendencies and his disregard for democratic norms. Despite these challenges, Bolsonaro remains a popular figure among his supporters, who see him as a strong leader who is willing to take bold action to address the country's problems.

Boris Johnson.passage: Boris Johnson is a British politician, journalist, and former Mayor of London. He was born in New York City in 1964 to British parents and was educated at Eton College and the University of Oxford. After graduating, he worked as a journalist for various newspapers, including The Times and The Daily Telegraph, where he became known for his controversial and often humorous writing style. In 2001, Johnson was elected to Parliament as the Member of Parliament (MP) for Henley-on-Thames. He quickly gained a reputation as a maverick politician, known for his outspoken views on a range of issues, including the European Union, immigration, and the environment. In 2008, he was elected Mayor of London, defeating the incumbent, Ken Livingstone. As Mayor, Johnson oversaw a number of major projects, including the construction of the Olympic Park for the 2012 Summer Olympics and the introduction of the Boris Bike scheme, which provided a network of public bicycles for hire across the city. He also championed the Crossrail project, a major new railway line that will run through London and the southeast of England. In 2016, Johnson became a leading figure in the campaign for the United Kingdom to leave the European Union, known as Brexit. He was a prominent member of the Vote Leave campaign and was widely seen as one of the key figures in securing the victory for the Leave side in the referendum. Following the referendum, Johnson was appointed as Foreign Secretary by Prime Minister Theresa May. However, he resigned from the position in 2018, citing his disagreement with May's Brexit strategy. In July 2019, he was elected leader of the Conservative Party and became Prime Minister of the United Kingdom, succeeding Theresa May. As Prime Minister, Johnson has faced a number of challenges, including the ongoing Brexit negotiations and the COVID-19 pandemic. He has been criticized for his handling of the pandemic, particularly in the early stages, and for his controversial decision to prorogue Parliament in 2019. However, he remains a popular figure among many Conservative Party supporters and is known for his charismatic and often humorous style of leadership.

Scott Morrison.passage: Scott Morrison is an Australian politician who has been serving as the Prime Minister of Australia since August 2018. He is a member of the Liberal Party of Australia and has been a Member of Parliament (MP) for the Division of Cook in New South Wales since 2007. Morrison was born in Sydney in 1968 and grew up in the suburb of Bronte. He attended the University of New South Wales, where he earned a Bachelor of Science in Applied Economic Geography. After graduation, he worked in tourism and marketing before entering politics. Morrison's political career began in 2000 when he became the State Director of the New South Wales Liberal Party. He held this position until 2004 when he was appointed as the Managing Director of Tourism Australia, a government agency responsible for promoting tourism to Australia. In 2007, he was elected to the Australian Parliament as the MP for the Division of Cook. During his time in Parliament, Morrison has held several ministerial positions, including Minister for Immigration and Border Protection, Minister for Social Services, and Treasurer. As Minister for Immigration and Border Protection, he oversaw the implementation of the controversial policy of offshore processing of asylum seekers, which has been criticized by human rights groups. In August 2018, Morrison was elected as the leader of the Liberal Party of Australia and became the Prime Minister of Australia following the resignation of Malcolm Turnbull. Since taking office, Morrison has focused on issues such as economic growth, national security, and climate change. Morrison has been praised for his handling of the COVID-19 pandemic in Australia, which has been relatively successful compared to other countries. He has also been criticized for his government's response to the bushfire crisis in 2019-2020, which many felt was inadequate. Overall, Morrison is a controversial figure in Australian politics, with supporters praising his leadership and opponents criticizing his policies and actions.

Jacinda Ardern.passage: Jacinda Ardern is a New Zealand politician who has been serving as the 40th Prime Minister of New Zealand since 2017. She is the youngest person to hold this position in over 150 years and the second woman to do so. Ardern is also the leader of the New Zealand Labour Party, which she has been a member of since 2008. Born in Hamilton, New Zealand in 1980, Ardern grew up in Morrinsville and Murupara. She attended the University of Waikato, where she earned a Bachelor of Communication Studies degree. After graduation, Ardern worked as a researcher for the Labour Party and later became the President of the International Union of Socialist Youth. In 2008, Ardern was elected to the New Zealand Parliament as a list MP for the Labour Party. She quickly rose through the ranks and was appointed as the party's spokesperson for Youth Affairs, then later for Justice and Children. In 2017, Ardern was elected as the leader of the Labour Party, becoming the youngest person to hold this position. During the 2017 general election, Ardern led the Labour Party to a surprise victory, forming a coalition government with the New Zealand First and Green parties. As Prime Minister, Ardern has focused on issues such as child poverty, mental health, and climate change. She has also been a strong advocate for women's rights and has implemented policies such as paid parental leave and equal pay legislation. Ardern gained international attention in 2019 following the Christchurch mosque shootings, in which 51 people were killed. She responded to the tragedy with compassion and empathy, earning praise from around the world. Ardern also implemented strict gun control measures in the aftermath of the shootings. In 2020, Ardern was re-elected as Prime Minister in a landslide victory, with the Labour Party winning an outright majority in Parliament for the first time in over 20 years. She has continued to prioritize issues such as climate change and social justice, and has been praised for her leadership during the COVID-19 pandemic. Ardern's leadership style, which emphasizes empathy and kindness, has been dubbed "Jacinda-mania" and has earned her a global following. Narendra Modi.passage: Narendra Modi is an Indian politician who has been serving as the Prime Minister of India since 2014. He is a member of the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) and the Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS). Modi was born on September 17, 1950, in Vadnagar, a small town in the state of Gujarat, India. Modi started his political career as a member of the RSS, a right-wing Hindu nationalist organization. He later joined the BJP and rose through the ranks to become the Chief Minister of Gujarat in 2001. He served as the Chief Minister of Gujarat for three consecutive terms, from 2001 to 2014. Modi is known for his economic policies, which have focused on promoting entrepreneurship, attracting foreign investment, and creating jobs. He has also been a strong advocate for digital India, promoting the use of technology to improve governance and increase transparency. Modi's foreign policy has been marked by a focus on improving India's relations with its neighbors and expanding its global influence. He has made several high-profile visits to countries such as the United States, China, and Japan, and has been instrumental in strengthening India's ties with these countries. Modi has also been a controversial figure, with critics accusing him of promoting a Hindu nationalist agenda and being intolerant of religious minorities. His government has been accused of cracking down on dissent and limiting freedom of speech. Despite these controversies, Modi remains a popular figure in India, with many people seeing him as a strong and decisive leader who is committed to improving the country's economy and global standing. His government has launched several ambitious initiatives, such as the Swachh Bharat Abhiyan (Clean India Mission) and the Make in India campaign, which aim to improve the country's infrastructure and promote manufacturing and entrepreneurship. Overall, Narendra Modi is a complex and polarizing figure in Indian politics, with a legacy that is likely to be debated for years to come.

Benjamin Netanyahu.passage: Benjamin Netanyahu is an Israeli politician who has served as the Prime Minister of Israel since 2009. He was also the Prime Minister from 1996 to 1999. Netanyahu is the leader of the Likud party and is known for his conservative views and strong stance on security issues. Born in Tel Aviv in 1949, Netanyahu grew up in Jerusalem and attended high school in the United States. He served in the Israeli military as a soldier and officer in the elite Sayeret Matkal unit. After leaving the military, Netanyahu studied at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology and Harvard University, where he earned degrees in architecture and business. Netanyahu began his political career in the 1980s, serving as Israel's ambassador to the United Nations and later as a member of the Knesset, Israel's parliament. He was appointed Deputy Minister of Foreign Affairs in 1988 and later served as Minister of Foreign Affairs from 2002 to 2003. Netanyahu's first term as Prime Minister began in 1996, when he defeated incumbent Shimon Peres in a close election. During his first term, Netanyahu implemented economic reforms and pursued a hardline approach to security issues, including the construction of Israeli settlements in the West Bank. After losing the 1999 election to Ehud Barak, Netanyahu briefly retired from politics and worked in the private sector. He returned to politics in 2002 and was elected leader of the Likud party in 2005. In 2009, Netanyahu was once again elected Prime Minister, this time in a coalition government with the centrist Kadima party. During his second term, Netanyahu has focused on security issues, including the threat posed by Iran's nuclear program. He has also pursued peace negotiations with the Palestinians, although these efforts have been largely unsuccessful. Netanyahu's leadership style has been described as strong and decisive, but also divisive and polarizing. He has been criticized for his handling of the Israeli-Palestinian conflict and for his close relationship with the United States under President Donald Trump. Despite these criticisms, Netanyahu remains a popular and influential figure in Israeli politics. He has been re-elected several times and is widely regarded as one of Israel's most important and influential leaders.

Recep Tayyip Erdogan.passage: Recep Tayyip Erdogan is a Turkish politician who has been serving as the President of Turkey since 2014. He previously served as the Prime Minister of Turkey from 2003 to 2014. Erdogan is the founder of the Justice and Development Party (AKP), which has been in power since 2002. Erdogan was born in Istanbul in 1954 and grew up in a working-class family. He attended Marmara University in Istanbul, where he studied economics and business administration. After graduating, he worked as a semi-professional football player and later as a manager in a local government office. Erdogan's political career began in the 1970s when he became involved in Islamist politics. He was a member of several Islamist parties before founding the AKP in 2001. The AKP won a landslide victory in the 2002 general election, and Erdogan became the Prime Minister of Turkey. During his time as Prime Minister, Erdogan implemented a number of reforms aimed at modernizing Turkey and improving its economy. He also pursued a policy of rapprochement with the European Union, although Turkey's accession negotiations have stalled in recent years. Erdogan's tenure as Prime Minister was not without controversy. He was accused of authoritarianism and of suppressing dissent, particularly after a series of protests in 2013. He also faced criticism for his handling of the conflict in Syria and for his government's crackdown on the Kurdish minority in Turkey. In 2014, Erdogan was elected as the President of Turkey in the country's first direct presidential election. He has since consolidated his power, with the AKP winning a majority in the 2015 general election and a constitutional referendum in 2017 granting him sweeping new powers. Erdogan's presidency has been marked by a number of challenges, including a failed coup attempt in 2016 and a deteriorating relationship with the United States and other Western countries. He has also faced criticism for his government's crackdown on the media and civil society, as well as for its handling of the Syrian refugee crisis. Despite these challenges, Erdogan remains a popular figure in Turkey, particularly among conservative and nationalist voters. He has been praised for his efforts to improve the country's infrastructure and for his strong leadership in the face of external threats. However, his critics argue that his authoritarian tendencies and his government's human rights record pose a threat to Turkey's democracy and its place in the international community.

Hassan Rouhani.passage: Hassan Rouhani is an Iranian politician who has been serving as the President of Iran since 2013. He was born on November 12, 1948, in Sorkheh, Semnan Province, Iran. Rouhani is a Shia Muslim and has a degree in law from the University of Tehran. He also holds a Ph.D. in constitutional law from the Glasgow Caledonian University in Scotland. Rouhani has been involved in Iranian politics for several decades. He was a member of the Iranian parliament from 1980 to 2000 and served as the Secretary of the Supreme National Security Council from 1989 to 2005. During his tenure as the Secretary of the Supreme National Security Council, Rouhani played a key role in negotiating a ceasefire between Iran and Iraq in 1988. Rouhani is considered a moderate politician and has been a vocal advocate for reform in Iran. He has called for greater political and social freedoms, as well as improved relations with the international community. Rouhani has also been a strong supporter of the nuclear deal between Iran and the P5+1 countries, which was signed in 2015. As President of Iran, Rouhani has implemented several reforms aimed at improving the country's economy and social conditions. He has worked to reduce inflation, increase foreign investment, and improve access to healthcare and education. Rouhani has also taken steps to improve relations with neighboring countries, including Saudi Arabia and Iraq. Despite his efforts to improve relations with the international community, Rouhani has faced criticism from hardliners in Iran who oppose his moderate policies. He has also faced criticism from human rights groups who accuse his government of suppressing political dissent and violating human rights. Overall, Rouhani's presidency has been marked by both progress and challenges. While he has made significant strides in improving Iran's economy and relations with the international community, he continues to face opposition from hardliners and human rights groups. Nevertheless, Rouhani remains committed to his vision of a more open and prosperous Iran, and his efforts to achieve this goal have earned him both praise and criticism from around the world.

Mohammed bin Salman.passage: Mohammed bin Salman is the Crown Prince of Saudi Arabia and the country's Deputy Prime Minister. He was born on August 31, 1985, in Jeddah, Saudi Arabia, and is the son of King Salman bin Abdulaziz Al Saud. Mohammed bin Salman is known for his ambitious plans to modernize Saudi Arabia and diversify its economy away from oil. Mohammed bin Salman began his political career in 2009 when he was appointed as a special advisor to his father, who was then the Governor of Riyadh. In 2015, he was appointed as the Minister of Defense, making him the youngest defense minister in the world at the age of 30. As defense minister, Mohammed bin Salman led Saudi Arabia's military intervention in Yemen, which has been criticized for causing a humanitarian crisis in the country. In 2017, Mohammed bin Salman was appointed as Crown Prince, replacing his cousin Mohammed bin Nayef. He has since launched a series of ambitious economic and social reforms under the banner of Vision 2030. These reforms include plans to privatize state-owned companies, attract foreign investment, and increase the participation of women in the workforce. Mohammed bin Salman has also been involved in a number of controversial incidents. In 2017, he ordered the arrest of dozens of Saudi businessmen and officials in what he called an anti-corruption crackdown. Critics accused him of using the crackdown to consolidate his power and eliminate potential rivals. In 2018, Mohammed bin Salman was implicated in the murder of journalist Jamal Khashoggi, who was killed inside the Saudi consulate in Istanbul. The CIA concluded that Mohammed bin Salman had ordered the killing, but the Saudi government denied any involvement. The incident sparked international outrage and strained Saudi Arabia's relations with the United States and other Western countries. Despite these controversies, Mohammed bin Salman remains a powerful figure in Saudi Arabia and a key player in the Middle East. His ambitious plans for economic and social reform have the potential to transform the country, but they also face significant challenges and opposition from conservative elements within Saudi society.

Chuck Schumer.passage: Charles Ellis Schumer is an American politician serving as the senior United States Senator from New York, a seat he was first elected to in 1998. A member of the Democratic Party, he has also served as the Senate Minority Leader since 2017. Schumer previously served in the United States House of Representatives from 1981 to 1999. Born in Brooklyn, New York City, Schumer graduated from Harvard College and Harvard Law School before entering politics. He was elected to the New York State Assembly in 1974 and served until 1980, when he was elected to the U.S. House of Representatives. Schumer was known for his strong advocacy for gun control and environmental protection during his time in the House. In 1998, Schumer ran for the U.S. Senate seat being vacated by Daniel Patrick Moynihan and won the election with 55% of the vote. He has since been reelected three times, most recently in 2016 with 70% of the vote. Schumer has been a vocal advocate for progressive policies, including healthcare reform, immigration reform, and LGBTQ rights. As Senate Minority Leader, Schumer has been a leading critic of President Donald Trump and his administration. He has been a vocal opponent of Trump's immigration policies, including the travel ban and the separation of families at the border. Schumer has also been a strong advocate for gun control measures, including universal background checks and a ban on assault weapons. Schumer has been known for his ability to work across the aisle and has been involved in several bipartisan efforts, including the Comprehensive Addiction and Recovery Act and the 21st Century Cures Act. He has also been a strong supporter of Israel and has been involved in efforts to strengthen the U.S.-Israel relationship. In addition to his political career, Schumer is also a published author, having written several books on politics and policy. He is married to Iris Weinshall, the former Commissioner of the New York City Department of Transportation, and has two daughters.

AOC (Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez).passage: Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez (born October 13, 1989) is an American politician, activist, and member of the Democratic Party who has served as the U.S. Representative for New York's 14th congressional district since January 3, 2019. The district includes the eastern part of the Bronx and portions of north-central Queens in New York City. Ocasio-Cortez is a member of the Democratic Socialists of America and has been described as a progressive and a left-wing populist. Ocasio-Cortez was born in the Bronx to a Puerto Rican mother and a father of Puerto Rican and Bronxite descent. She graduated from Boston University in 2011 with a degree in economics and international relations. After college, she worked as an educational director for the National Hispanic Institute and as a bartender and waitress in New York City. In 2016, she worked as an organizer for Bernie Sanders' presidential campaign. In June 2018, Ocasio-Cortez won the Democratic primary for New York's 14th congressional district, defeating incumbent Joe Crowley, who had held the seat for 10 terms. She went on to win the general election in November 2018, becoming the youngest woman ever to serve in the United States Congress at the age of 29. Since taking office, Ocasio-Cortez has been a vocal advocate for progressive policies such as Medicare for All, the Green New Deal, and a $15 minimum wage. She has also been a critic of the Trump administration's immigration policies and has called for the abolition of U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE). Ocasio-Cortez has been the subject of both praise and criticism. Supporters have praised her for her progressive policies and her ability to energize young voters. Critics have accused her of being inexperienced and of promoting socialist policies that they believe are harmful to the economy. Despite the criticism, Ocasio-Cortez has become a prominent figure in the Democratic Party and a leading voice for progressive policies. She has been featured on the cover of Time magazine and has been named one of the 100 most influential people in the world by Time and Forbes magazines.

Mitt Romney.passage: Mitt Romney is an American politician and businessman who served as the 70th Governor of Massachusetts from 2003 to 2007. He was the Republican Party's nominee for President of the United States in the 2012 election, but ultimately lost to incumbent President Barack Obama. Romney was born in Detroit, Michigan in 1947 and raised in Bloomfield Hills, Michigan. He attended Brigham Young University and Harvard University, where he earned degrees in business and law. After graduating from Harvard, Romney worked for the management consulting firm Bain & Company before co-founding the private equity firm Bain Capital in 1984. He became wealthy through his work in the private sector and was involved in the management of several successful companies, including Staples, Inc. and Domino's Pizza. Romney first entered politics in 1994, when he challenged incumbent Democratic Senator Ted Kennedy for his seat in the U.S. Senate. Although he lost the election, Romney gained national recognition and became a prominent figure in the Republican Party. He was elected Governor of Massachusetts in 2002, defeating Democratic nominee Shannon O'Brien. As Governor, Romney implemented several policies aimed at improving the state's economy and education system. He also signed into law a healthcare reform bill that required all Massachusetts residents to have health insurance. The law became a model for the Affordable Care Act, also known as Obamacare, which was signed into law by President Obama in 2010. In 2008, Romney ran for the Republican Party's nomination for President of the United States, but lost to Senator John McCain. He ran again in 2012 and won the nomination, but ultimately lost the general election to President Obama. During his campaign, Romney faced criticism for his wealth and his perceived lack of empathy for working-class Americans. After his unsuccessful presidential bid, Romney returned to the private sector and became involved in various philanthropic and political endeavors. He was elected to the U.S. Senate from Utah in 2018, succeeding retiring Senator Orrin Hatch. As a Senator, Romney has been a vocal critic of President Donald Trump and has occasionally broken with his party on certain issues. Overall, Mitt Romney is a prominent figure in American politics and business, known for his wealth, his conservative views, and his occasional willingness to break with his party.

Ariana Grande (Note: She is not a politi.passage: Ariana Grande-Butera, known professionally as Ariana Grande, is an American singer, songwriter, and actress. She began her career in 2008 in the Broadway musical 13, before playing the role of Cat Valentine in the Nickelodeon television series Victorious (2010–2013) and in the spinoff Sam & Cat (2013–2014). She has also appeared in other theatre and television roles, and has lent her voice to animated television and films. Grande's music career began in 2011 with the soundtrack Music from Victorious. In 2013, she released her first studio album Yours Truly, which entered atop the US Billboard 200. The album's lead single, "The Way", opened in the top 10 of the Billboard Hot 100, with critics comparing her wide vocal range to that of Mariah Carey. Grande's second studio album, My Everything (2014), also entered at number one in the US, and contained the hit singles "Problem" and "Break Free". With the singles "Bang Bang" and "Love Me Harder" from the album, she spent 34 consecutive weeks in the top 10 of the Billboard Hot 100, and had the most top 10 singles of any artist in 2014. Her third studio album, Dangerous Woman (2016), debuted at number two on the Billboard 200, and its title track became her first top-five single on the Hot 100. The album also spawned the hit singles "Side to Side" and "Into You". In 2018, Grande released her fourth studio album, Sweetener, which debuted at number one on the Billboard 200 and spawned the hit singles "No Tears Left to Cry" and "God Is a Woman". Her fifth studio album, Thank U, Next (2019), also debuted at number one on the Billboard 200, with its title track becoming her first number-one single on the Hot 100. Throughout her career, Grande has received numerous accolades, including two Grammy Awards, one Brit Award, three Billboard Music Awards, and three MTV Europe Music Awards. Time magazine named her one of the 100 most influential people in the world in 2019, and Forbes included her on their annual list of highest-paid women in music in 2020. She has amassed over 200 million followers on social media, and has been named the most followed woman on Instagram.

Mike Bloomberg.passage: Michael Rubens Bloomberg (born February 14, 1942) is an American businessman, politician, philanthropist, and author. He is the co-founder, CEO, and majority owner of Bloomberg L.P., a global financial services, software, and media company headquartered in New York City. He served as the 108th Mayor of New York City from 2002 to 2013. Bloomberg was born in Boston, Massachusetts and raised in a middle-class Jewish family in Medford, Massachusetts. He graduated from Johns Hopkins University in 1964 with a Bachelor of Science degree in electrical engineering. He then attended Harvard Business School, receiving a Master of Business Administration degree in 1966. After graduating from Harvard, Bloomberg worked at Salomon Brothers, a Wall Street investment bank, for 15 years. In 1981, he was fired from Salomon Brothers and used his severance package to start his own company, Innovative Market Systems, which later became Bloomberg L.P. The company provides financial software tools and data services to financial professionals around the world. Bloomberg was elected Mayor of New York City in 2001, succeeding Rudy Giuliani. He was re-elected in 2005 and 2009, serving a total of three terms. As Mayor, Bloomberg implemented a number of controversial policies, including a ban on smoking in public places, a ban on trans fats in restaurants, and a requirement that chain restaurants post calorie counts on their menus. He also launched a number of initiatives aimed at improving public health, reducing crime, and promoting economic development. After leaving office in 2013, Bloomberg returned to Bloomberg L.P. as CEO. He has also been active in philanthropy, donating billions of dollars to various causes through his Bloomberg Philanthropies foundation. In 2020, Bloomberg ran for the Democratic nomination for President of the United States, but dropped out of the race after a poor showing in the Super Tuesday primaries. Bloomberg is known for his moderate political views and his support for gun control, climate action, and immigration reform. He has been criticized for his support of stop-and-frisk policing, which disproportionately targeted people of color, and for his close ties to Wall Street. Despite these criticisms, Bloomberg remains one of the wealthiest and most influential people in the world, with a net worth of over $50 billion.

Andrew Yang.passage: Andrew Yang is an American entrepreneur, philanthropist, and former presidential candidate. He was born on January 13, 1975, in Schenectady, New York, to immigrant parents from Taiwan. Yang attended Brown University, where he earned a degree in economics and political science. He later attended Columbia Law School, but ultimately decided not to pursue a career in law. After working in various startups and technology companies, Yang founded Venture for America (VFA) in 2011. VFA is a nonprofit organization that trains and places recent college graduates in startups in cities across the United States. Yang served as CEO of VFA until 2017, when he stepped down to run for president. Yang announced his candidacy for president in November 2017, running as a Democrat. His campaign focused on the idea of a universal basic income (UBI), which he called the Freedom Dividend. Under Yang's plan, every American adult would receive $1,000 per month, regardless of their income or employment status. Yang argued that UBI was necessary to address the economic challenges posed by automation and artificial intelligence. Despite being a relatively unknown candidate at the start of the race, Yang gained a significant following online and in person. He qualified for all of the Democratic debates and outlasted several more established politicians. However, he ultimately suspended his campaign in February 2020 after a disappointing showing in the New Hampshire primary. Since ending his presidential campaign, Yang has remained active in politics and public life. He launched a nonprofit organization called Humanity Forward, which advocates for UBI and other policies to address economic inequality. He also became a commentator on CNN and a frequent guest on podcasts and talk shows. In 2021, Yang announced his candidacy for mayor of New York City. His campaign focused on issues such as affordable housing, small business support, and public safety. However, he ultimately finished in fourth place in the Democratic primary, behind Eric Adams, Maya Wiley, and Kathryn Garcia. Throughout his career, Yang has been known for his unconventional ideas and approach to politics. He has been praised for his ability to connect with young and disaffected voters, as well as his willingness to challenge the status quo. However, he has also faced criticism for his lack of political experience and some of his more controversial proposals, such as the use of "smart cameras" to monitor crime in New York City.
